messageBody:
On 1/19/06, Robert Lucente <rlucente@...> wrote:
>
> Googled and found http://www.w3.org/DOM/Test/Documents/DOMTSBuild.html.
>
> The above states, "If you get a out of memory error (very likely if you
> build the DOM Level 3 Core tests)". It then recommends "set
> ANT_OPTS=-Xmx512M". Request that people share how they solved their "out
> of
> memory" issue.


FYI, we did this in TestNG by allowing @Factories to return either test
classes or iterators. In the latter case, the iterators are walked one
element at a time, the yielded elements are considered as test classes (or
further iterators) and run, and then we move on to the next element.

Some of our users are creating thousands of tests and they were running out
of memory without this feature. It's marginal, but when you need it, you
really need it.

Hope JUnit4 will provide it.

--
Cédric
